The Raising of Jairus’ Daughter

by Matthew Brailas in The Occasional Loin on Oct 3, 2013 • No Comments
And straightway the damsel arose, and walked… and [he] commanded that something be given her to eat. Jairus, whose name means   “God will awaken.” Softly: his daughter. Softly: night’s passage. Fever holding her throat in its teeth.   She sweats. She dies before Christ arrives. Now his words pull her up by her tongue....

Music

Kiss Land

by Chithra Mithri in The Occasional Loin on Oct 3, 2013 • No Comments
I have a confession to make: I’m not a hipster, especially when it comes to music. If anything, I’m a reverse hipster; I only hear about things that are popular way, way after they actually are. That’s why I have a Backstreet Boys poster in my room.

Reflections

Jared Garland

by Jared Garland in The Occasional Loin on Oct 3, 2013 • No Comments
Call me Moses Goldstein. You won’t be wrong. Say it and I’ll turn around, look back at you out of the corner of my eye, smile a bit and raise an eyebrow at you coyly, because I’m a coy guy, and—of course—that is my name.
